Reviews.Title: “The Flagship Aloft... at least that is what I was told”
Reviews.Author: OneTravelerHere
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aloft in Dallas because I needed to be downtown and it was an SPG hotel. The rooms were nice as the high ceilings definitely provided a different feeling from a standard hotel room. The lounge area in the lobby had a pool table and plenty of seating. The "pantry" in the lobby provided a place to buy small food and drink items in case you did not want the full restaurant experience or just needed something quick. Unfortunately, a large group of young people showed up after my first night for some kind of film event. The hotel was crawling with young people with camera and lighting equipment. I was ok with that but things got noisy and crowded at night. The lounge was unusable after there arrival. I even got a flier under my door reminding me of quiet times and minimum ages to roam free. I felt like I had landed at a Spring Break hotel. Parking was in the adjoining parking lot. My only complaint here is that you park, check in, then have to go back to your car to put the tag on the mirror. It wouldn't have been a big deal if it were not raining and 1 AM after flight delays.

Reviews.Title: “A modern oasis”
Reviews.Author: dean d
Reviews.Content: I wanted to thank you for a terrific stay at Aloft Dallas. I had a superb time from check in at the Aloha desk with Reagan who greeted me warmly and was up on the happenings for the weekend in the Big D. Thomas also at the Aloha desk was most helpful with the jack hookups and friendly. I had a wonderful room with view of the bronze longhorns and appreciated the design from the rocking retro chairs and plexiglass faux tree trunk coffee table to the sumptuous bed, Bliss toiletries, and efficient use of space. I also loved the jack set up and connection to the TV which was so unique as I have been to many 5 star hotels that donâ€™t have the feature. Splash was refreshing and Refuel was an oasis. I would like to especially thank Gil who was a most cheerful and accommodating individual who knows how to anticipate needs. There was a turkey club sandwich that I wanted but it had bacon. He prepared a fresh sandwich for me without bacon and was able to substitute a small salad instead of potato chips thanks to Jesse at the Aloha desk who was so gracious and hospitable. I returned to my room thinking I should have told Gil to heat up the sandwich since there was cheddar cheese and the melted cheese would be so tasty. When I took the sandwich out of the wrapping foil it was heated. I went back to thank Gil and bought a grain bar which he freshly prepared as well and it was piping hot. Gilâ€™s attentiveness and taking time for the little things that make me happy was just dandy! I finished my stay and checked out with Thomas. Again a fitting end to great weekend. I enjoyed my time immensely and look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Reservations suck!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: I couldn't even get a reservation at this hotel because they force customers to book a mandatory three-night stay. They had rooms available, but only if you were willing to stay Friday-Monday nights. Staying Friday-Sunday was evidently completely unacceptable to them. Totally not practical. And then they disconnected me when I attempted to lodge a complaint. Great service, not....

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: GCFWTX
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have stayed at this property about 8 times in the last year. The staff is always curtious and welcome to help with any request no matter how big or small (within reason). The XYZ bar is fun at night after getting in from a concert or dinner etc. Eat at Charlie Palmer in the JOULE, a bit $$$$ but WELL worth it. Aloft is great, you wont be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Makes Dallas cool”
Reviews.Author: gpscheib
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in downtown Dallas. Once a train station, then a textile warehouse. The rooms are funky, modern, and comfortable with a 42 inch flat screen TV in each room. Staff was friendly and professional. Will definitely stay here next time I'm in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “The usual Aloft Experience in an Interesting Building”
Reviews.Author: InHouseCounsel
Reviews.Content: I am a fan in general of the Aloft concept- the rooms are clean, functional and not as boring as some lower priced chains. There is always a nice gym with up to date elliptical and treadmill equipment, and there is always a cool bar area. What set this Aloft apart was the location in Downtown Dallas in an old brick building full of character. Check in was easy, and the staff noted my platinum status and said I would be in an upgraded room. I was not sure what to expect, since I thought pretty much all the Aloft rooms were alike, and I had never received any sort of upgrade in one. As soon as I walked in the room I saw what he meant- the room was huge, easily twice the size of the Aloft rooms I am used to, with exposed brick walls and floor to ceiling windows on one side. The room had the usual wall mounted flat screen tv and a box on the desk that enabled you to hook up a computer or game unit to the tv, a safe, free bottled water and coffee, and the usual walk in shower with Bliss amenities. The only downside of the room was that a marathon was being held Sunday morning, so I woke up at 6 am to loud music and a big crowd out front of my room, which faced the convention center. Given the marathon crowd, I grabbed breakfast in the lobby and enjoyed a ham egg and cheese sandwich for $3, with free coffee. Overall, a great experience. If I needed to stay in downtown Dallas again, this would be my choice.

Reviews.Title: “This place makes me happy.”
Reviews.Author: Baronent
Reviews.Content: Why can't all hotels that cost $75 or more a night be like this? Free bottled water. Cheap parking. Nice staff. Nice products. Huge, clean room. Nice cozy bed. They even threw in a $10 comp in food! So basically, parking, or the food, was "free". The places I am used to, you have to pay $29+ for parking EACH NIGHT and all you get is a bad parking space. This place charged me $10 and gave me breakfast! Love the look and feel of this hotel. If this room was in California, it would be over $200/night. Huge window that opens to the city. A real shower with a real shower head! Ironing board. Fridge. Coffee. Free WiFi! Huge flat screen TV that pretty much stares at you from the center of the room with a "watch me" look on its face. I did watch it and I normally do not watch TV in hotels. Very quiet other than the outside, city noise. Noise downtown? I like it. Hustle and bustle. A nice area to walk around, across the street. Some sort of buffalo exhibit or something. I decided against crossing the street to check it out, but it LOOKED cool from a distance. Didn't see much else other than a McDonald's nearby. Loved the layout of the room. When I walked in, I thought they had upgraded me to a suite. I was on the 7th floor. Did not use the gym, but I checked it out. It had decent cardio machines. Lighting was fantastic throughout the property. Really young, hip, friendly staff. VERY convenient, no hassle parking. Only had a few problems: I asked for an 8:30am wake-up call, and I received a call at 8:05am. That was odd. I also bought a sandwich from the lobby. An amazing sounding Buffalo Mozzarella and Tomato. Brought it up to the room and it was TOTALLY soggy. The bread was soaked. Couldn't eat it. Nasty. Was in a hurry, so I did not complain about it. Another strange thing. They have these really cool computers where you can print up your boarding pass for your flight. Southwest Airlines is basically a TEXAS, LOVE FIELD Airline. The hotel has all SORTS of airlines available on those computers, even ones I never heard of, but NOT Southwest Airlines. The woman behind the counter had to print mine for me and she could only print ONE leg of my flight. Strange. The other "nice" properties that I found online for Downtown Dallas were all close or above $200/night. They could NOT be better than Aloft. Save yourself $100 and stay at this hotel. Anyways, I had a LOT to work to do so I was "locked up" in the room most of the time. And I liked it. I felt like I was in my own little studio. Brought me back to my college days, minus the drunk girls and dirty dishes. Carpet looks brand spanking new. Bathroom: HUGE.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Business Trip to Dallas”
Reviews.Author: bwhite220
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, the staff at Aloft in Dallas is top notch. I stayed there for a week long business trip at the Dallas Convention Center (0.5 miles away) and I had nothing but the most exceptional customer service experience. My room was perfect. Everything is laid out exactly how I would have done it. The amenities were great. The atmosphere was superb. The WXYZ bar in the lobby was first-class. Their onsite parking was only $10.00/night which is far less than any of the other hotels around and the site is within walking distance of everything. I've stayed at a number of other Aloft hotels around the country and this one is by far the best. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: homeykat
Reviews.Content: We were in Dallas for an event at the convention center. The Aloft was straight across the street. We were on the ninth floor. Our room wasn't a loft style. I loved our room, it was beautiful and comfortable. The ninth floor was added onto the top, the other floors are more loft like, with exposed brick and such. The lobby has something going on every night, stay above the third floor if noise bothers you. I saw some interesting events during my 4 day stay. There is a convenient area in the lobby that sells essentials and snack foods. It was much more cost effective to go to CVS a couple blocks away. The lobby and bar are absolutely beautiful. I loved hanging out down there. I hope to stay at the Aloft every time I'm in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for the convention center!”
Reviews.Author: Manningjen
Reviews.Content: I was pleased to stay here during a conference at the Convention Center--just 1 block away--and found that I was paying less than many other conference attendees staying in hotels blocks farther away. Room was huge, well kept, designed for modern electronics, and the bar is fun. The breakfast to go area in the lobby works fine with me, I don't need anything fancier! I love staying in an old building (a former warehouse) with a history!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: TexsunJAG
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel last weekend. We have stayed here many times before, itâ€™s such a nice place to relax, and at a great price! Nice clean rooms, and very well managed! My wife and I were at the bar one night, and it was very crowded, but one of the managers was out on the floor, making sure everyone was being taken care of. Thank you Marci Wenrich! You are a true asset to your company! All in all, another great stay at the Aloft! Greg

Reviews.Title: “aloft does the important things right”
Reviews.Author: NoisInNc
Reviews.Content: A three night stay for business was my first experience with the aloft brand. The things that are most important to me they did well - comfortable bed/clean sheets, large and well appointed room, quality towels, social area in lobby, decent fitness center, and location to the convention center. Also front desk staff is well trained and very helpful. The little things were where they fell down a bit, and would concern me as the hotel ages a bit - torn wallpaper in my room, useless coffee maker, cheap toilets that require multiple flushes, iron didn't work. Some attention to details would make this an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “COLD, warehousey, arty, modern, youthful.”
Reviews.Author: MildManneredTraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Aloft because it was the conference hotel for a business trip. When I first walked in the lobby after a long and wearisome plane ride, I looked around and sincerely wondered whether I would be able to get any rest in there. Unpainted concrete and bare brick was the dominant finish, offset by jazzy colors in the lighting and furniture. There is a scent of citrus. The reception desk is a small circular concrete island that resembled a coffee kiosk. Three high-energy workers were squeezed into the tiny space in the middle. Getting checked in actually went pretty quickly - the workers were quite fast and efficient. None looked over age 22. My worries were allayed when I got to my room. The minimalist decor was restful enough and it was absolutely quiet in there. I liked the tall ceiling and I adored the wall of windows opposite my bed. Some people have said that this is an all-suite hotel. It is not. Mine was a simple, single room with a bath, but it was certainly big enough for just me. Most rooms however were much larger. My main experience of this hotel though was the COLD. Here's a tip if you are at all cold-natured, BRING WARM PAJAMAS! And a cozy sweater. I always travel with an electric heating pad just in case the hotel room is cold, and boy it really saved me this time. The best advice I could give you is to test the thermostat just as soon as you check in and see if it responds to your instructions. If it doesn't, ask for it to be fixed right then, don't wait until you are already in your pajamas and tired and have to wait for them to send a guy up. That's what happened to me. After multiple tries to stop the arctic blast blowing into my room, they sent up a guy they called an "engineer," he poked the buttons of the thermostat for about five minutes, said he thought it was probably fixed and that he would monitor it remotely. Well, it didn't fix it and he didn't come back. I only stayed two nights anyway so I decided it was only worth so much fuss. I wore my coat in the room. But if I had researched hotels in advance, I might have stayed in the elegantly beautiful Omni instead, or maybe one of the historic hotels nearby. I really don't have that much against the Aloft, it simply wasn't the right choice for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great design, great location”
Reviews.Author: klipmom
Reviews.Content: If you like modern boutique hotels with a bit of quirkiness, you'll love the Aloft. They have copies of Dwell magazine in the rooms and that is fitting, the hotel's vibe is very much like that magazine. The rooms are large, with high ceilings and an entire wall of windows, with great views. The beds were very comfortable as well. My only quibble with the room was the lack of drawers; I like to put things away, and it was hard to do with just a couple of shelves and a small hanging area for clothes. While there isn't a restaurant, there is a bar and a small food service area that met the needs for breakfast and snacks. In the morning there is good, free coffee starting at 6 am (the day I had to be at the convention center at 6:20, the coffee made me very happy). They also have limited room service, but I didn't use it. They even have coin operated laundry and the desk will give you quarters for the machines. The staff was friendly and helpful. And the location, a block from the convention center was ideal. There is even a pool table in the lobby, a pool and a small fitness center. This hotel isn't for everyone, but if, like me, you think traditional furniture is staid and ugly, the Aloft may be a great place for your home away from home in Dallas.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “Trendy in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Yvette B
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at the ALOFT! The staff was super friendly and helpful, the rooms spacious, with a modern flair. I loved the floating vanity and the sheets were so luxurious. An added bonus: bar in the lobby AND right across the street from the convention center. While this hotel may not be everyone's cup of tea, it suited me to perfection. Would definitely recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: C Z
Reviews.Content: I am visiting from the UK. The hotel with its roominess and all it's amenities is far different from a European hotel. I have stayed in the ALoft on several occasions and always had such a pleasant experience. The staff is very friendly and accommodating for whatever the guests need/request. I loved the design of the rooms-large and convenient. I would recommend the hotel for others and plan to stay here on future visits to the states.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Aloft Dallas Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Christi O
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights last week and loved it! The staff was so friendly and accommodating. The beds were very comfortable and clean. There were four of us in a room and we had plenty of hot water and room. I thought the decor was very cool. Others have mentioned the concrete sucking out the heat. We never had this problem. I would stay there again. Loved the hot coffee and muffins in the mornings. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, but not thoughtfully designed, lacking in amenities and service”
Reviews.Author: Kathy I
Reviews.Content: In my 6-day stay, the housekeeping was erratic and the room never warmed up. The window opened - a plus - but never closed tightly. There is no restaurant; a particular annoyance when you have to go out in the rain for a breakfast beyond cold cereal or an English muffin. The handkerchief-sized "heated" pool was also cold. No bathtub, no hand shower, no complimentary hotel car as offered by neighboring hotels, no business center and an incomplete selection of airlines on the boarding pass printer. Most frustratingly, the slow wi-fi kept throwing up a splash screen offering bargain rates - $30 less than I was paying a night. The staff, mostly very young, were friendly and well-intentioned if not always on top of things. This hotel tries to play in the big leagues but fails.

Reviews.Title: “Style lacking substance”
Reviews.Author: campfiar
Reviews.Content: Remember that kid in Junior High that thought he could be more popular by wearing jeans with a dress shirt and penny loafers? The one that covered up all his insecurities with distinctive fashion. If he came to life as a hotel you would have the Aloft Hotel in downtown Dallas. I like the fact that the developers of this hotel gave an old building new life. I also admire the attempt to keep nostalgia alive. What I didn't appreciate was knowing that I could have stayed in any number of nearby hotels and had a better experience. First impressions are important and the Aloft won me over initially. The lobby is expansive and funky. You get a good vibe right from the beginning. However, my first impression quickly wore off upon reaching my room. The appearance was good but when I tried to use the wifi to catch up on the emails I had missed during my flight, no dice. I improvised by going old school and plugging into the LAN - strike two. The front desk assured me they would "reset the connection for my floor". That didn't work either; at least not in time for me to use it before my first meeting. I tried again when I returned that evening. Got a connection but it was slower that dial up. I don't base my hotel experience solely on the internet connection. There were other things that turned me off as well, such as scratched and peeling wallpaper and light switches located far from the bed, requiring you to walk in relative darkness back to bed. The shower never got hot either; warm, but not hot. When I went to the lobby kiosk to print my boarding pass I experienced more retro technology and had to go behind the front desk counter to take care of it. It rained virtually the whole time I was in Dallas. The hotel employees wer good about calling cabs for guests but I would have preferred loaner umbrellas or a hotel shuttle for nearby drop-offs. My experience at this Aloft left me thinking that they were trying to emulate the look and feel of the Courtyard rebrand implemented over the past few years. In my opinion they have fallen far short. I try to be positive with my hotel reviews, so let me finish with this. The location of this hotel is very good. You feel safe here and it's within walking distance of many cool things to see or do in downtown Dallas. If your mission is business, my recommendation is to look elsewhere. If you're a gal who thought the geeky preppy kid was cute and you're looking for a place to hang with your besties for a girls' weekend, I think the Aloft will score well with you.

Reviews.Title: “Younger brother of W Hotels failed to meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: wow445
Reviews.Content: Being part of the SPG family, I did expect a lot out of Aloft, which is SPG's modern, hip brother of the W Hotels, and it certainly attracted many young professionals. Right when you walk in, you will definitely be taken aback by the decor of the place. A former warehouse then transformed into a boutique-ish hotel, the space is modern and young, with a casual check-in counter that doubles as a cashier for the small convenience store that they call Re:fuel. There's also a lounge area called Re:mix with a pool table and LCD TV playing sports all day. The hotel bar is called WYZ and it is actually pretty popping at night, mostly from the guests staying there though. Checking-in was pretty smooth and we got to our rooms without hassle. However... that's where the problem starts. First, my wireless phone in the room kept on making double beeps as if it was out of battery. Called front desk and when they sent an engineer up, the engineer waited with me for over 10 minutes waiting for the phone to beep again. I felt so bad and told him it was alright so he did a hard reset on my phone just in case it happened again. Next, I wanted to check out the view from my room and when I tried to use the remote for the automated curtain, it didn't move at all! Called front desk and reported the problem and they said the engineers were off so they will check on it tomorrow. In the morning I left and then when I got back, the problem wasn't fixed so when I was downstairs I mentioned to the front desk. That was when they told me that some rooms' curtain had malfunctioned and they were waiting for parts so they can retrofit it into a traditional pulled up curtains -____- Super fail on Aloft's part. The shower was also a huge issue. On the first night my co-worker complained that he didn't have hot water at all, then on the 2nd night, it happened to me. Called front desk and their explanation was that since it is an old building, the pipes' pressure isn't as strong so he suggested me turning on the faucet as well as the shower. It did work, but the water was definitely just a step above warm. Fail once again. Used the hotel's gym a few times as well. Like other SPG hotels, they provide towels and headphones just in case you don't have any. The headphones were kinda useless though since the TVs on the cardio machines weren't connected to the cable and you could only get the basic. Some didn't even work well... As for the weight equipment... not much, some free weights and a pulley machine with a situp machine. Fairly limited. The Re:fuel section is a small market and they sell things from muffins and cereal in the morning to Red Bull and Naked juice. Of course, it is overpriced, but the blueberry muffin was pretty damn delicious, although a muffin, Naked juice, and a cookie costs me $8-9. The things I did like about the hotel were the modern space, the pool table, the spacious rooms, and the free-wifi. However, even the wi-fi had a bit of trouble since they were in the process of setting up new routers. All in all, it's a cool business hotel and has everything you need when traveling for business, but there's just way too many problems for me to say that it was an enjoyable stay, especially as an SPG member expecting SPG quality.

Reviews.Title: “meh”
Reviews.Author: mjhm3
Reviews.Content: FREEZING cold shower. Heat in room runs for 5 minutes then reverts to A/C. Impossible to get warm! Wearing down coat over pj's. I was going to say how great the front desk staff is (points for smiling faces) however: they have the phone on perma-busy so you cannot dial through from the room. Reservations, wake-up call, "aloha desk" even EMERGENCY are all busy, all the time. Frustrating. So you have to call from your cell phone. OK, maybe something is up with the phones. However I have called twice about the arctic freeze up here. The promised engineer is no where in sight. First time = last time. Stay somewhere else. oooh - engineer just appeared. Still staying somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst.”
Reviews.Author: jennifer d
Reviews.Content: Cold shower. Thermometer in room didn't work. Free wi-fi as slow as molasses. Trendy concrete walls and pipes on the ceiling made me feel like I was in a post-nuclear holocaustal warehouse. No restaurant. Terrible food selection in the pantry - - Beefaroni was the highlight. Elevators didn't run smoothly or quickly, despite low to no traffic on them. No area information in rooms. A blunt, unsharpened pencil on table, no pen. Lights didn't work well, took a while for them to turn on, and then they were very low. Maid service included not emptying the trash containers, not leaving fresh towels, not replenishing cups or coffee. Closet space dismally small, and that's after you even find it. When you DO open the tiny cubby hole they call a closet, the hangers run not horizontally, which is logic, rational and supports finding your hanged items with ease, but perpendicular to you, so you only see the first item of your clothing and have to rummage through all your clothes to find what you want. I hate this hotel. Never, ever, ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, retro....”
Reviews.Author: KLM53
Reviews.Content: January, 2012, our second trip to Dallas--we chose the aLoft. Very modern-with-a-retro-look hotel with absolutely wonderful front desk staff. We've traveled worldwide; this has been one of our most pleasant stays. Young men at the front desk recommended restaurants and made reservations for us. After two days of convention attendance, we had a box full of brochures and information--they arranged to have it shipped home for us. Can't say enough "good" about them. This is an all-suite hotel; we had a king suite that was spacious and comfortable. There is a deli-type food area but no restaurant. They do have a kitchen open in the morning for a simple breakfast. There are restaurants within walking distance so this was not an issue for us. Convention center is two blocks away. If you are only participating in downtown and/or convention center activities, consider taking the TRE (Trinity Railway Express) from DFW Airport. Cost = $3.50 each way per person. Clean & modern. Beats a $100 round trip taxi!!! You can definitely get by with no car if you're staying downtown and don't mind walking. Union Station (train station) is a very comfortable 4-5 block walk--even with luggage (on wheels)--to aLoft. Dallas people have been most friendly to us on both trips.

Reviews.Title: “Cold shower!”
Reviews.Author: LMN4002
Reviews.Content: Clean and unique room. Free Internet - well, you get what you pay for; it didn't work. This problem + no hot water made this a one-time visit for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business stay”
Reviews.Author: Bostonner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aloft Dallas Downtown for a business trip and it was conveniently located just a walk away from the convention center. The hotel rooms look like they are from a converted warehouse (brick walls, exposed pipes, etc.), so it is good if you are looking for a modern. For food, there is a wide variety of breakfast and lunch food options (I saw a chef cooking breakfast in the morning). There are several places to sit and eat, but not a restaurant. The bar does serve food (think appetizers, small plates) so it is good if you are looking for a quick bite, but I would not recommend for a sit-down meal. The staff was extremely helpful and answered any requests quickly and courteously.

Reviews.Title: “ok... if you're 20 and want to party”
Reviews.Author: MissWisc
Reviews.Content: I suspected I was in trouble when the cab driver from DFW had never heard of the place. It's a recently remodeled warehouse - only been in use as a hotel for a couple of years. The desk staff consists of a handful of 20 somethings who can be complimented for their enthusiasm and willingness to print out a Mapquest of anyplace you want to go, but getting something like ice, another towel or an extra blanket takes several requests. The rooms have all the basics you need, but it's not a "warm" place at all - literally. The windows don't seal and it's very drafty. Because it's a renovated a warehouse everything is cement with thin squares of carpet strategically placed. It's known as a place that can be rented for raves, and the cement structure sends the vibrations from the basement party room throughout the entire building; sleeping on those nights is difficult. One evening the bar area had been rented for a private party so the hotel guests had very limited access. The bar staff were very good, but it's rude to be told we couldn't sit at the bar when we're staying at the place. We arrived one night to a valet attendant insisting he had to park our car even though we were hotel guests with a parking pass. The manager on duty, a lovely young lady who had helped us with other things, went with us to chat with the valet attendant. He reluctantly acquiesced, but seemed miffed that he should have to take orders from a woman and was surly to us when we returned to our car later. The pluses: You're walking distance to Union Station and the West End. There's a 24 hour McDonalds a block away. It's across the street from the convention center. The view of the changing lights on the outside of the Omni hotel a block away. I think I'll stay at that Omni next time.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelChic
Reviews.Content: May be modern.... but NO modern luxuries! NO valet. NO room service. NO restaurant. NO service! Many other choices in Dallas!! Room was modern, but small.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: R S
Reviews.Content: Nice enough building, former warehouse nicely renovated. Terrible service. The "aloha" desk attendant was very young and had no idea what he was doing. Complained about two puddles of vomit in front of the elevator bank on 9th floor. Still there 12 hours later. Unacceptable. Incredibly loud music coming from basement all night until 6am. Two nights in a row! Staff did not do anything when I complained. Hallway smelled like marijuana Terrible night of sleep. Seemed like a place where trashy loud people come to party. Stay away! Check out the brand new Omni down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes modern doesn't mean comfort.”
Reviews.Author: Fire_fly0414
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an easy access area which makes it easy to get around the city to all attractions. The lobby is upbeat and fun. The bar also attracts a good crowd. Rooms are clean but we found the bathroom area a bit cumbersome for 2 people. There is no room service and very little in the way of extras so if you need something you can buy it at the stand in the lobby. Overall I think if you want a single this is a good choice. If you are a couple keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed with Aloft”
Reviews.Author: 1Maggie
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on its location and the raves about service and the quality of the rooms. Clearly those reviewers received much better accomodations that we did. We have a tiny room on the 9th floor that overlooks the roof. Lighting is poor, the wi-fi is horrible, and there is zero information in the room re: hotel anemnities or local area things to do. What appears to be passing for "loft style" in our case is just chintzy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Trendy”
Reviews.Author: BransonMO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aloft hotel while in Dallas during a Seminar. The hotel is very trendy and nice inside. While I was there they had an art display going on in the lobby and I really loved that. They have a nice sitting area and bar area also. It was so easy for us to get to the arena. While most of ladies had to take a bus from other hotels we just had to walk a few blocks. Now I am sure its very popular during the yearly seminars and a first pick for many going to this seminar! I did have an issue with my card being over charged. I shared the room with two other ladies and we all had to split the room. For some reason when I got home I was charged for I believe the whole room. They were very nice and took care of it for me, it just took a little extra calls to get it done. But I understand mistakes happen and they did a good job fixing it for me. The rooms were as trendy as the rest of the hotel, very nice. Big bed and fold out sofa. I was not expecting the sofa bed to be so comfortable. It was a nice suprise. And considering there were 3 of us ladies who had to get ready twice a day the room was very spacious and accomodating for this. Pool was very nice and relaxing. And also another great feature was the meeting room on the floor we were on (which I cant remember). It was a big comfy room to hang out in. Overall great place, when I return to Dallas I will return to Aloft!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice 2nd Choice...”
Reviews.Author: DVazquez
Reviews.Content: We had a business meeting at the Aloft downtown Dallas during December 2011. We rented a meeting room space and booked 20 guest rooms. The Pros: The staff was just amazing. Service is 5 star service! Note that name, it is a loft style with very nice dÃ©cor. Very clean place. All the guest rooms have flat screen TVâ€™s with cable and free Wi-Fi. This location is just at the end of the â€œdowntownâ€� area, so you are minutes away from everything. You can walk to most places â€“ to save on cap fares. Meeting room space is very fun and you can do a lot with this space. Weddings, parties, etcâ€¦ They have very nice exercise equipment and room. Self-serve food area with good choices. Cons: Their guest rooms are limited with water pressure and hot water The business center only lets you print your boarding pass; they do NOT have any Microsoft office and pdf capability to print or view those documents. And you canâ€™t make copies of anything, as they donâ€™t have a copy machine. The do NOT have a restaurant onsite; you will have to leave for all meals. The meeting rooms are cold, because it is a cement warehouse. Ladies, bring your wraps. Over all is nice; however I would not book this for our meeting again, but would book it for a party or any type of a reception.

Reviews.Title: “Aloft Dallas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 7barb
Reviews.Content: Easy to access from I-35 situated within that great Dallas skyline view. Comfy queen sized beds with soft down comforters. Massive sized room in an old train station, then factory building. Massive shower. Breakfast not included but reasonably priced to go type items and they do make sausage/egg sandwiches and the like. did not use the outdoor pool or the exercise area. Incredible decor. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy”
Reviews.Author: happytodoit
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here. Unconventional set up, loved it. Clean, modern appointments. Nice choice of food, walking distance to some great restaurants. Would definitely stay again. Great vibe

Reviews.Title: “Value alternative to W”
Reviews.Author: Mark F
Reviews.Content: Nice property downtown near city hall. Checked in mid afternoon needing a snack and self serve food area had lots of choices and made it easy (no waiting for room service). Staff was friendly and efficient. Liked the modern room with ease of use for business traveler looking to work. Good price point for larger room and good facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, not beautiful”
Reviews.Author: mdld
Reviews.Content: We were in Dallas for a conferance and had reservations at Aloft several months in advance. When we checked in we were asked if we wanted a higher or lower floor. We said higher, we like to have a view... we were given a room on the 2nd floor, we unpacked then opened the drapes only to find that the windows were 5 feet off of the floor! We literally had to stand on a chair to see out of our windows! We decided we did not want to pack up and move to a different room... the shower the next morning was COLD... it would only warm up if we left it running for over 10 minutes..... hate to do that, we like to conserve water when possible. Another worker was traveling with us, he had a room on the 6th floor, nice view, and warm water. Overall, the room was quiet, the decor was trendy but not beatiful. People seemed to be enjoying the lounge area with the free pool table...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: wndpwr1
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights latter part of October on the 7th floor. No internet. Called the help desk around 7 PM and after a long time and calls back and forth was told they needed to reset a server and it would be on within an hour. Finally came on at 10:30. So went to take a shower and no hot water! Stood in the shower for five minutes waiting. Called front desk and a maintenance person responded quickly. He ran the shower and sink for a long time - no hot water, not even warm. He was at a loss; said there was hot water in the basement but he had responded to several complaints of no hot water that day. He said he would try something - that was,run the water in a room on the second floor to bring the hot water up. Sounded inplausible to me but somehow that worked. When I checked out my bill was $80 more per day than the rate I had reserved in June. Was told that I made the reservation a week and a half ago and that was the rate then. Went to the desk to show printed receipt for reservation made in June and they had already discovered their error and printed a new bill. When they handed the new bill to me they asked how my stay was. I mentioned the lack of hot water and internet connection. Got a completely ambivalent "sorry". I'm a member of the Starwood Preferrd Guest program but really having doubts...

Reviews.Title: “Champagne experience for a beer-budget price.”
Reviews.Author: FundingPro
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times. It's within walking distance to most downtown attractions, and I've even walked all the way uptown to the McKinney Ave. hotels and restaurants from there. It's a renovated old building that's been redone in a quite modern style. It has an open lobby floorplan with a pretty cool bar and a self-service pantry with a mix of food and beverage items. It doesn't offer a full-service breakfast, but you can purchase made in-house hot breakfast sandwiches and pastries that are very good. The rooms are quite large and are tastefully decorated. They've got excellent AV gear, and really good high def which I've sometimes found lacking in hotels in this value band. The room layouts can be a little quirky because they adapted them to the old building. The beds are comfortable and the whole place still smells new. My only complaints are that It tends to attract a young crowd on the weekends, and given the location it always seems like I get a few hallway partiers around 2AM (may be a + for some people). Also the wifi is spotty. I've had them change rooms for me when I'm there on business just to get a better signal. As for the service, I would classify it as excellent. I've had similiar experiences as other some other reviewers where they checked me in early, etc. I tend to chalk that up to the fact that the front desk guys are a pretty loose bunch who seem intent on having a good time. Overall I would say it's unbeatable for the price. I usually pay around $100/night which is ridiculous considering the location. My recommendation is to stay here and walk over to the Joule and the W for fine dining and cocktails. It's a champagne experience at a beer-budget price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal!”
Reviews.Author: Jen H
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel late on a Friday afternoon when preparation for a Halloween party was in full swing so we didn't really get a good feel for how the Hotel would be on a "normal" day. Even though they were clearly very busy the staff member at the front desk was super helpful and friendly which was nice. We were impressed with the size of the room and also the overall look and feel of the Hotel, it's super modern and interesting and the room are well appointed. Our only complaint was the water pressure in the shower and the fact that they had no internet access (for someone travelling without a lap top). This is a great central location and we enjoyed checking out the sculpture garden across the road. We didn't really get our (paid for) breakfast in the morning as there was a big clean-up going on but it didn't bother us that much. We grabbed a cup of coffee and a muffin (which was tasty). We will definitely stay in one of these Hotels again, it was a good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: FortWorthJeffie
Reviews.Content: Checked in early on 10/26/2011. In fact I arrived in Dallas at approximately 7:00 AM and went to the front desk and asked if I could leave my luggage there behind the desk while I attend the conference. The front desk individual (Keith) said I could check in now. Really appreciated that. Had a room on the 9th floor. Overall impression of the room: Clean, chic/ultra modern in it's look. Bed was excellent along with the bath & wash towels- thick and absorbent. The only complaint I would have is the lighting in the room. I am a reader in bed and the only lamp available was the lamp by the desk. I know I quibble but.... Overall, a very nice experience from room to staff. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really cool revamp of a warehouse type building, helpful staff, and great location.”
Reviews.Author: amclark78
Reviews.Content: The rooms are rustic brick walls and original warehouse windows. Beds are comfortable, neat accessories in the rooms, and a great and very helpful staff. The one way streets can be a little tricky, but all in all it was a great place to stay. Walking distance to where JFK was shot and other cool landmarks.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, cool downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kristi E
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in Aloft property. My room was one of the coolest rooms I have ever stayed in. It was quiet, the bed was comfortable, and the shower was awesome. I had a burger and Bloody Mary in the bar, both were really good. Location-wise, it was easy to get to and more importantly, it was easy to get out of downtown from this location. I was here for the Dallas half marathon, and the start-line was right outside the front door, very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very different , yet modernly elegant.”
Reviews.Author: WKU-Wanderer
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at an Aloft property. The room was spacious, clean and modern. The bed was Japanese styled and was easy to sleep on. The shower was one of the best in any hotel that I have stayed, to date. Overall, a different but welcome experience after a long drive. One oddity was that the ice machines are on the first floor, kind of a hassle when you are on the 7th. Not a biggee, but not convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lindy B
Reviews.Content: I work for a sports radio station and we stayed at the Aloft over the weekend while covering a game. It was such an amazing stay! Where to begin! The staff welcomed us with open arms...they were very friendly and very knowledgeable about the area. The hotel had easy access on and off the highway, and it was in walking distance of Main Street with great shopping, bars and restaurants. The hotel lobby was so inviting and comfortable with plenty of seating and the bar was a nice little hangout. The "re-fueling" area was pretty important with such a long weekend! This is where you could buy 24-7 sandwiches, chips, fruit, anything to satisfy the tummy! And the building...wow...it's a mix of historic downtown Dallas with a flare of contemporary living. I highly recommend a suite! It was clean and cozy. They have a gym with all the necessities and a pool for lounging (which I was only able to look at, not use because of our busy schedule). So, if you are on business or pleasure, check out the Aloft!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location too remote”
Reviews.Author: Autumn814
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the all star game. Loved the hotel but not the location. Not ideal when going out in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “A-loft was A-mazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Misha G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights for a birthday celebration/concert weekend...and it was GREAT! the service was wonderful, my girlfriend's birthday was on Saturday, that morning, while we played pool, I arranged for Marcy from their food and beverage to deliver some chocolate covered strawberries while we were out shopping. Jennifer, the mgr at the front desk, took it one step further and had the dozen roses I bought her setup (with the card I left with her) and had some rose petals on the bed around the platter of strawberries...leading to the vase of roses and card on the desk. It was AWESOME!! When we came back to the room, it was all set up...My girlfriend was sooo surpirsed too! The room was very nice, small but just perfect for us and we loved the fitness room and the pool...a great place to chill. We really enjoyed the pool table and bar in the lobby too! We will be coming back very soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cool Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 9NK4
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in Dallas, and the Aloft definitely gave it a good first impression! I was a little nervous before coming because I had read lots of reviews on here complaining, but the only one that turned out to be true was the Wi-fi problem (which, really, wasn't that bad. I wouldn't suggest coming if internet is absolutely crucial, but I was able to look a few things up on the iPad, it just ran slowly). The overall design of the hotel is very modern, in a cool way. I know this is a weird thing to say, but I was really impressed with the outside landscape! It wasn't stunning or anything, I just really liked it for some reason; it seemed very organized and well thought out. The rooms were nice too! Very spacious, with great beds, an awesome view, and a good bathroom (no bathtub, but that didn't bother me). Also, the soaps and shampoo products are high quality (I'm blanking out on the brand, but it's a good, well known one!). Overall, I give Aloft two big thumbs up. Next time I visit Dallas, I'll definitely be staying there. Side note, check out the elevator floors! I didn't notice until we were leaving that they light up like that!

Reviews.Title: “Good for weirdos”
Reviews.Author: lizrainh2o
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a neat part of town - but be aware that downtown Dallas is rough. The design is extremely modern and open. The parking is in an open lot, so don't expect valet. However, this is a nice perk if you like to come and go a lot. There was not a single person working the front desk over 25. They were all perfectly capable people, but just really lacked the experience that comes with good customer service. Very scattered. Same goes for the bartender. After waiting quite awhile when the place was virtually empty, the bartender took my order (I ordered two beers and two wines), filled my two beers, and then took and filled another person's order while I waited for the remainder of mine. Oh, and it was all served in plastic cups. The room is small, but efficiently laid out. If you are looking for any level of bathroom privacy, you will not find it here as the walls are paper thin and do not go all the way to the ceiling, and the shower has a frosted glass wall that leads to the bedroom area. Yes, you can see (and hear) everything. Our AC was not working in our first room, and we were quickly moved to another room with a working AC. The pool deck is gorgeous, but gets sun from 8:30 to 10:30 am as it is on the wrong side of the building. Dallas is in the middle of a record heat wave (over 100 degrees for the past two months everyday) and the pool was way too cold because it is in the shade all day. Lastly, the clientele - what a bunch of weirdos. Granted, this has nothing to do with the hotel quality or service, but this place attracts weirdos. I suppose if you have a really trendy hotel in a downtown urban area that is priced pretty reasonably, you're going to get weirdos. Really loud, drunk weirdos, who stay up late and come home at 4 a.m. and scream in the hall. We experienced this both nights we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Style over Substance (or Comfort)”
Reviews.Author: AbbeyRenee
Reviews.Content: I wish they had a "Comfort" rating option. This hotel has great style and some cool amenities but I slept TERRIBLY. It is noisy (not loud neighbors - just walls so thin I could hear every normal outside sound), the curtains never blocked the light even in the middle of the night, there is only one light switch so if you wake before your spouse you have to sit around in the dark, and the worst was the bedding. I had a choice between a tissue-thin sheet & 4"-thick down comforter (in a Dallas August). Would have been fine if it was 5-10 degrees warmer or 30 degrees cooler but instead it was just a whole night of waking up hot & cold. It's also a little ridiculous that there is NO included breakfast of any kind. Everything is a la carte & expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay - I don't expect I'll stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Kees929
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the things that were good. I liked the lobby and the bar/lounge downstairs. Their concept around a self-service food area seemed to work pretty nice as well. Normally I go out for meals but this was really useful when I got in late the first night and just wanted something beyond what a vending machine would have available. I liked the room design in general. I don't need/want a huge hotel room. The flat screen tv was a good size. Now the bad. The wifi didn't work in my room. I was at the end of the hallway. The signal strength basically wasn't strong enough. If I walked out into the hallway it worked. Just not in my room. I talked to support - they couldn't get anywhere with me. It wasn't a deal killer but I'd rather sit on the bed and veg a bit while I watch tv with my laptop. I was able to get on the wired network but that meant I was tethered to the desk in the corner. Granted it was very fast Internet. The location of the ironing board was completely non-obvious. It was around the bed in the corner in a hidden space behind the headboard. The hot water didn't work. Okay, it made it not completely frigid but it wasn't even lukewarm. EVER. It wasn't even a time of day thing. I think this is just an old hotel that was refurbished and they did a bad job. It wasn't just me, either. My two other co-workers had the same issue with the hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: BendORJed
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, friendly & helpful staff. Nice, big room. Location to the convention center was the best perk- less than a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Place ... Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: PitcherJLT
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay somewhere different than our normal Holiday Inn Express or Omni Park West for our hotel stay on this trip to Dallas for the Rangers game. The location was good downtown, plenty of parking, simple check-in and check-out, and the guy working the front desk was very nice and helpful. The "look" of the hotel is really cool and I personally like the way it is somewhat left unfinished. The room was an adequate size, very clean, and pretty modern. The only thing my wife did not care for was that there was not a bathtub -- only a shower and the only issue I had was that we were on the 2nd floor above the pool and there was a group down there that was being very loud. I had a tough time falling asleep until the pool party ended. Overall, I think it is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “WE Loved it and we will be back, not orginal but true.”
Reviews.Author: roquet26
Reviews.Content: Didn't know how I would like the HIP decor, but found it most pleasing and fun. The lounge has great food and did not try the breakfast selections but from observation looked great for the busy traveler. Good coffee. EXCELLENT staff and service. It was hot in Dallas so did not try the pool as it was crowded. Loved the concept and being able to dim the lamps was cool. Working desk and internet worked well. Definite recommendation to stay work or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and that's about it”
Reviews.Author: LJWNYC2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business meeting (also held there) and was underwhelmed. Seemed like a cool concept, but in practice that's all it was - a cool concept. My room was very clean (always important!) and very minimalistic as far as decor, which was fine. But that's where the praise ends. It was very dark and half the lights didn't work. It was pretty small and in fact the shower was set up so that you could see the person showering from the main room (some sort of weird glass, rather than a wall, connecting them). One of the blinds was totally broken, making it darker. The lights above the bed didn't function, the toilet ran constantly and there was a sound like being in the middle of an airplane hanger. The wakeup calls came late and no one called to check when one day I didn't answer (I was already in the shower). They didn't bring me any new towels (even though I made it clear that I needed them). The cordless phone was out of batteries. So all in all, my feeling was the room was poorly maintained from anything other than a cleaning standpoint. Oh - and booking for this hotel was incredibly difficult - the people I spoke with on the phone were completely incompetent. They didn't know what the conference was that I was referring to. Yes they did! They were out of rooms for the conference two months out. No they weren't - they had plenty of rooms! They couldn't find my reservation (I was on hold for 45 mins). They found it! They lost my reservation. They found it again! In the end, the company sponsoring the conference booked my room - I could no longer deal. Then when I tried to get an online receipt for the room (to do my expense report) they said it would take a week to send it. Then, when a week went by and I didn't get it, someone else managed to send it in two minutes. The location isn't great either. They do have good wasabi almonds at the bar though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Iboo
Reviews.Content: Great, modern and a bit funky hotel!! Loved the stay. Comfortable beds, great linens! Amazing staff!! Will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: mplstravel
Reviews.Content: This Aloft Hotel is a renovated military uniform factory and each room is unique as are the beautiful art-inspired common areas. The customer service is terrific -the staff will assist with whatever you need. They go the extra mile n

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time, worth every penny!!!”
Reviews.Author: KKittelson
Reviews.Content: The hotel and amenities were outstanding along with very helpful and knowledgeable staff. The rooms are reasonably priced, especially for the location. Every part of our stay was excellent and we will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly pleased, would definitely recommend.”
Reviews.Author: bijte
Reviews.Content: It definitely caters to a younger 20-30's demographic, the decor and room furniture is distinctly dormitory feeling, BUT the rooms were ginormous. Given the size of the room, the bathroom was a little on the small side, but nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. If you are looking for a fun hotel that's on the youthful trendy side, this is a good choice. There is not a lot of night life in the immediate vicinity so be prepared to drive somewhere else, but the ride will not be too long.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: jsfountain
Reviews.Content: One week spent at this hotel for a conference in Dallas. Great location for downtown. Beautiful hotel and impressive rooms. Large rooms with lots of space. Ambiance of the hotel is very modern and chic. The lobby feels more like a club or a bar than a hotel lobby. Hotel staff are exceptional! The best. There is no restaurant but you can order food from the bar. Food is also available at the snack area 24 hours a day. I would enjoy staying here again on another trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Industrial and funky”
Reviews.Author: mccainmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aloft Downtown Dallas on a business trip. Place is interesting in concept and geared towards a young traveler's taste sporting an industrial loft like look in the lobby, hallways and guest rooms. Lobby can be noisy due to the concrete and metal. Very trendy but not particularly my taste. Desk staff a little stiff but very professional. Like the wall dispensers in the bath area as I believe that will reduce down on soap waste which I have always hated.

Reviews.Title: “Left Electronic Toothbrush - and now it's MIA”
Reviews.Author: masen372
Reviews.Content: Liked the hotel, pretty cool concept all in all and perfect for business travels. Only complaint is I accidentally left my electronic toothbrush in the room. After checking with Lost/Found 2x...no luck. Clearly housekeeping took it and passed it along to someone (who knows!). Who would want an old toothbrush is beyond me, but it makes me wonder whatelse they'd take or refuse to return to hotel guests. think about it. Hotel was pretty indifferent to the fact. I can understand on some level, but perhaps the GM and leadership team should educate housekeeping on the proper protocol. Makes me not want to ever stay here again, and I am in Dallas alot for business.

Reviews.Title: “This is now my hotel of choice in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: christinrich
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving they told me they changed my reservation to a suite without explanation and I was not going to argue, who would? I loved the room, very modern and comfortable at the same time. The location was great and although parking is $8/night I didn't mind. Most hotels charge much more for parking now so $8 was totally fine with me. I liked the casual ease of this hotel. The best part was how quiet the room was, I slept really well (which isn't typical for a hotel). This is now my hotel of choice in Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: at_the_track
Reviews.Content: i had never stayed in Aloft before, so didn't know what to expect. Kind of weird walking into a hotel lobby with the noise blasting at you. Ceiling about 25" tall. Easy check in. Accommodated a change in type of room that I wanted. They put me on the second floor, right above the bar area. I was leery of being able to sleep, but didn't hear a thing. I couldn't believe it. The rooms are spacious. The room has indirect lighting. Strange configuration. Either all the lights are on, or all the lights are off, except for one over the shower. So if someone gets up in the middle of the night and wants to turn the bathroom light on, the switch turns them all on. There were no drinking glasses. And only one regular coffee set up and one decaf. So if two of you are there, someone gets decaf. And you can only make one cup at a time anyway. The beds are not Sheraton standard, not quite as comfortable. There is a half-ironing board, not full size. And the room has a fridge, but no microwave. Also, they don't have vending or ice machines anywhere other than in the lobby. Free wired and wifi, and portable electronics plug in and play on tv screen. Which is a 35" flatscreen. There is no inroom directory or phone book, so if you want a pizza, you have to figure that out some other way. There are two desks in the room, but only one chair. And it is shower only, no tub. There were two styrofoam cups for the coffee. There is a parking charge of $8. It is only one block from the convention center, so very easy to leave your car there and walk over. There is a place to order food. I had a breakfast sandwich, and it took a good ten minutes. There were only a few people in front of me, but the cook told me he is only allowed to make two sandwiches at a time. This was 10:00 on a Saturday. I don't know how you would ever get anything hot on a weekday at 7:30 am. Probably have to settle for bagels, cereal, or yogurt. The employees are friendly and will go out of their way to help you with anything. I didn't get a chance to see if there was a restaurant anywhere near by. But what they have there is just a simple kitchen with basic items, such as sandwiches, salads, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best value but loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: Ro409
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! Loved the historic district and the lovely walk on a busy Saturday or a night out Sunday. A walk around the town is a must! Lovely views and busy nightlife. Best for the young who only need a place to sleep. The location is small and the desk people are not the friendliest but overall a great experience. Will be back if i need to be in the downtown area. Not a homey room but a good room to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “WORST EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE”
Reviews.Author: Apedesky
Reviews.Content: PLEASE READ!!! DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!! I stayed at this hotel with another couple on New Years and it was the absolute worst experience of our lives. To start the front desk rep. asked us for our social security number after copying down every other scrap of information we own. When we asked why he needed it he only said that he suddenly didn't. He then gave us the wrong room 3 different times! We ordered one of the "Deluxe Ultra Savvy Suites" and 3 different times he tried to put us in a different room. It took the assistant GM to finally get the room right. Then they refused to let us pay in cash. Later that night a fight broke out in the hallway outside our door. Someone began wildly knocking and when we open the door some woman rushed into our room assaulting people. It was madness. We had NEVER seen anything quite like it. The police and security conveniently never found the perpetrators and we then asked to leave the hotel because we didn't want to stay in that dump another minute. At checkout the front desk rep. named Carly informed me there would be no charges placed on the room and that because there were no charges there was therefore "nothing to sign". I asked her to check and double check and the answer remained the same. Three days later our card was charged for the account. I called the hotel and the assistant GM April then told me shed get it resolved and that she'd call back within an hour. Three hours pass and I go up to the hotel only to be greeted by a rude and inconsiderate man named Scooter who is supposed to be the GM and owner. This awful man proceeded to accuse us of never leaving the hotel and refused to refund the charges. DO NOT STAY HERE!! THEY WILL ROB YOU AND LIE TO YOUR FACE! In addition, the two bedroom rooms have completely transparent showers, there are cards in the room advertising that the hotel provides amenities that they don't! When we asked the front desk they had no idea what we were talking about. When we brought them down the card saying that the hotel would provide these things, they simply stood there took the card and claimed that they were just out. IF YOU'RE LOOKING FOR TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE AND RUDE AND AWFUL ATMOSPHERE THEN THIS IS CERTAINLY THE PLACE YOU SHOULD GO.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT DEAL !”
Reviews.Author: kataTexas
Reviews.Content: this was a wonderful hotel in downtown Dallas ! the rooms were new, exciting , and comfy; the bar is only open in evenings and the specialty drinks were fantastic ! the bar menu is limited but good food! there is a little pre-made food bar in the morning, nothing was great there but if your in a hurry- go for it ! it is directly across from all government building , so if you have a meeting there...this is the place to stay ! what a gem for the price !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A modern contemporary outstanding hotel with great service and amenities.”
Reviews.Author: schmico
Reviews.Content: A hidden gem in downtown Dallas. The service was impeccable, the rooms very trendy and probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The Aloft is walking distance to most restaurants and convenient to most downtown destinations. The only negative was the heating/air conditioning system in the rooms that was difficult to control. All employees were very responsive to all our needs. I would highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Young and chic. Excellent place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: druann13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Aloft in downtown Dallas. A young, chic and excellent place to stay. From the time we were greeted by the receptionist to the time we checked out, our stay was pleasant and relaxing. The lobby was fun and inviting. Big pool table. A wonderful area to socialize. It offers wifi for those business travelers and a great bar area to relax. It was nice to see how the architects used the existing structure (old brick wall, industrial height ceilings) to incorporate the high end amenities. Once in our room we were met with a huge flat screen TV, great and comfortable bed (goose down comforters, great pillows, soft sheets,need I say more) and we particularly loved the bathroom. Such clever and functional placement of things, For example, the shower had the shampoo/conditioner dispenser. No more wrangling with a tiny bottle of shampoo where you lose the top right off the bat. The shower had great water pressure and heated up fast. Just hanging your clothes was cool! The tiered contraption that came out from the wall was something I had never seen before. Huge windows that face no one so you can walk around with whatever you want on. Huge mirror! We walked outside to catch the elevator and noticed a room that you could use for meetings. Downstairs you can grab coffee, latte, fruit and a whole list of yummy things. We grabbed a coffee, paid a very nice person and were on our way. Next time we are in Dallas, we are definitely staying there!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NHT2009
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for some place different this is your place. Not the standard chain hotel, you feel special here. Loft style with high ceilings, modern furnishings and a great location. Would go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “New to Aloft and a good first experience”
Reviews.Author: kANDsErgreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights (a Thursday and Friday). Great pre-paid, non-refundable rate. Upon check out I inquired what the occupancy had been, as there wasn't much noise in the hallways and the public areas didn't seem too crowded. They said "70-90%". We enjoyed the public spaces (lobby bar/lounge, gym) and our room. Parking in the lot next to the building was $8.00/night, charged to our room account. Good soaps and shampoos (pump dispensers in shower). Bed comfortable/good sleep. High ceilings gave a spacious feel. Each day, the In-room coffee maker couldn't seem to be used again after the first cup of hot water for tea; we had to instead get a cup of Starbucks from the lobby. Flat screen TV in room is nice, if the latest and greatest in electronics is important to you. Since this building is a converted warehouse, the original, single-pane windows in the shower and sleeping area could potentially be a noise liability, if road construction and/or loud party goers in the parking lot below are in effect. In our case, a loud road project outside didn't start until later in the morning anyway. The lobby-area self-serve, "food to go" amenity was pretty cool. PIck your favorite soup, add hot water, toast your bagel and grab a salad to picnic in your room with. Reasonably priced. Location seemed a bit on edge of downtown, but was a quick drive to the Reunion Tower at the Hyatt for a great round of martinis while watching the city below, all the while spinning in the revolving restaurant/lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Never again, horrible and disorganized”
Reviews.Author: Doogie63
Reviews.Content: Yes, I have had two bad experiences with this particular hotel. I was first intrigued with its urban downtown beauty, which if you are going for a bar experience I highly recommend. However, the customer service is horrible. My business associate requested her pants be dry cleaned and they had them back to us within 1 hour (after they told her to bring them down to her, not very customer service oriented) well they were pressed, but who can dry clean suit pants in one hour? They didn't, they pressed them and proceeded to argue with her because she refused to pay the amount since the gigantic food stain was still on the pants! They also say they had a shuttle that could take us to and from the meeting. LIES they had yet to mention to us that they hadn't hired a driver, so we had to wait and hope that someone would be available to take us to our meeting at the Hyatt (which the following year I opted to stay at the Hyatt and avoid this fiasco). There is no spa, which is a downer, employee's can be snooty, and very immature. Dead cockroach was found in room and was overall very unimpressed. If you are looking for a great stay within the Starwood preferred guest line I would recommend the chain of W hotels, much classier and much better in all aspects.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel brand”
Reviews.Author: PinaColada02
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at the Convention Center and was so excited to try this hotel since I'm a fan of the W Hotels. Happily this hotel did not disappoint. It takes the modern style of the W Hotels and brings that to a slightly lower tier hotel that maintains the cool, sleek amenities of the W Hotels while combining them with do-it-yourself loft style features. The first thing I noticed is the novel and very smart layout of the room. It was quite spacious and roomy but everything you need is there and is organized/laid out well. I love how the bathroom was designed so that the sink is separate from the toilet and shower and the "closet"/clothes storage area is close to the bathroom, and how the sink instead of being centered in the counter is towards the left leaving you with more counter space for your toiletries. You can tell a lot of thought was put into function as well as form. My room had huge windows that let a lot of light into the room and was nicely designed. The bed was awesome as they all are in SPG properties. I used the 24/7 gym and it was great with nice equipment, very clean with all the needed amenities (towels, water, music, yoga mats, etc.) The hotel bar is really fun and not surprisingly busy. Great cocktails and great small bites. There's also a pool table that got a lot of use by the hotel guests. In terms of location, it's literally across the street from the Convention Center so very convenient if you're attending a show there and also still close to the hot spots downtown which are all a short cab ride away. I also loved how the hotel had a high end mini mart in the lobby where you could buy snacks, meals, etc. The one thing to know is there is no on-site restaurant, just the bar and mini mart but you're close enough to lots of great restaurants and the bar and mini mart are enough to satisfy any late night or snack cravings. Overall I highly recommend this hotel and can't wait to stay at another one.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: acantonLongview_TX
Reviews.Content: The Aloft Downtown Dallas is seriously the coolest hotel I have ever seen. The building is a historic brick that has a cool modern interior. It felt like we were staying in a modern art museum! The rooms are plush and spacious and feel very custom (our friends' rooms were all a little different and all were very unique). The porch with the lap pool and gym was our favorite hot spot. We spent most of our time hanging out at the bar, the pool table, the cafe, the pool... The hotel allows dogs but is still super clean and very eco-friendly. It markets alot to the 20 - 30s crowds and on the weekends the basment area turns into a club. We had alot planned for the weekend but cancelled it all just to stay at this hotel! I have our next stay booked at it's sister hotel in Frisco - stay tuned!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away, Especially for Corporate Meetings/Events"”
Reviews.Author: kb_mal
Reviews.Content: I chose the Aloft Dallas Downtown for an internal meeting in July. I was excited about the location and the modern vibe (a change from our usual meeting locales). So many things went wrong that I don't know where to begin. Our AV equipment was 45 minutes late to be set up (forcing us to start our meeting late). Breakfast wasn't ready on time despite e-mail reminders that it should be ready at 7:30. The bathrooms near our meeting space looked like they hadn't been cleaned in weeks. When I asked for the bathroom to be cleaned ASAP and no one came for more than an hour, I did my best to clean them myself. The office center printer didn't work nor the airline check-in kiosk. It was only after someone at our corporate office got involved that the staff started accommodating our requests and stopping by to check on our meeting. The decor and rooms look much nicer online than they do in person. Overall it seemed like the staff was clueless and didn't understand the value in an apology (for how badly everything was organized). I can say that the lounge area was popular with our group and we appreciated the complimentary drinks and some food they comped because of our experience - but that's about it. My recommendation is that you find somewhere else to stay. We canceled our second meeting and moved it to the Sheraton Dallas Downtown (much nicer).

Reviews.Title: “Great Get Away in the City”
Reviews.Author: katieshw
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I needed a break from the everyday grind, so we decided to stay in a hotel instead of with his family (who live in Fort Worth) when we visited the metroplex. We booked a room at the Aloft and loved it from the moment we walked into the lobby. The bar area had several people enjoying cocktails and playing pool. Our room was fabulous! It was decorated like a loft, with exposed concrete and piping. The bed was very comfortable. Unfortunately, there wasn't much of a view from the room though. It was walking distance to Pegasus Plaza, which features some great restaurants and bars. We are looking forward to our next "staycation" at the Aloft Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: hboss1225
Reviews.Content: Attending a EMS convention, this hotel is clean, quiet,nice bar, good selection of snacks / meals on the go/ great front desk staff/nice modern rooms with comfy beds/ ample parking / easy walk to convention center/ nice fitness center /nice ammeneties//

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tate20
Reviews.Content: I admit, I got a heck of a deal on the room rate, but even so, the suite was comfortable with room to spread out, conduct business and relax when each were needed. The modern decor on top of a re-purposed building is tastefully done. The Staff was outstanding and very helpful even when extremely busy (a convention housed LOTS of folks there). The meeting/party room downstairs (we used it for both reasons) worked out perfectly, but be warned you'll need to bring your own overhead, whiteboard, etc. equipment. Do NOT expect a free breakfast in the morning, this is not your budget rate hotel but a fine gem in the heart of Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: leona75
Reviews.Content: The location is not great for nightlife unless you take a cab, No restaurant on site, and the bar amounts to a bar in the lobby with seating for about 10. The air conditioning was not working in our room so at 10:30 pm we had to change rooms, staff didn't seem to think that was a big deal. No hot water on the second day. If you are looking for sleek and luxury you will not get it here. There is an extra charge for parking, no bellman or valet available.

Reviews.Title: “Where do I start I've stayed at many...”
Reviews.Author: jcqpad
Reviews.Content: Where do I start I've stayed at many starwood hotels W times square etc and other big hotels in Dallas downtown are and TOTALLY LOVED ALOFT, chic clean and fun Hotel I stayed with my daugher just for a day vacation because I running a 10k sunday am....we hung at the pool in the evening and walked around the cool hotel with all the fun art work we hung outside across at a dallas attracktion the brass long horns I love the REFUEL with snacks reall good ones, I didn't get a chance to eat at the restaurant because went to nearby retsaurants, but the pool is awsome and fun, thr rooms comfy and clean !!!!! The bed I didn't want to get up setup is eclectic, the bliss products the bomb, the people there were a nice crowd diverse group and the employees very kind and imformative I CAN't WAIT TO STAY AGAIN A MUST

Reviews.Title: “Cool digs without all that pesky service.”
Reviews.Author: BubbaDeluxe
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on a business trip. Check-in was very easy. Lobby was chic but temporary local art exhibit a little strange. Room was modern and spotless. Bed was large and clean but a bit to firm for my taste. In-room technology far surpassed other hotels. Like many other modern institutions, the hotel has leaned heavily toward modern technology and "chic-ness" and away from good old-fashioned customer service. Evening operator was rude, finishing a conversation with someone in his office (while I was listening) before answering my call. He also "had no idea" why my in-room telephone was beeping loudly and suggested I "press a few buttons." Then he hung up. So the place was OK. Not great. We did get a very good rate and the guest does feel very secure. Just hope nothing goes wrong, because you'll have to deal with humans. Yech!

Reviews.Title: “most amazing and friendly hotel I have stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: smiley69_10
Reviews.Content: We were there for a child nutrition conference. We chose not to stay at a host hotels for the conference and chose the aloft for the convience of being accross the street from the convention center. The entrance into the hotel was very different from others hotels I have stayed at. The exposed beams and different textures of the walls were very trendy and modern. They have created different areas of the lobby for hotel guest to mingle and visit. The front desk people at the aloft were friendly and helpful. Everytime you walked in or out you were always greeted with a smile along with a good morning or afternoon or evening. The pool was a salt water and was refreshing and relaxing. it was nice that it was outside and you did not have to have the echos of an inside pool. plenty of seats and conversation areas.
