After sitting in this pool you did not feel the sticky of a chlorine pool.The rooms were spacious and comfertable and made you feel so relaxed and I liked that the rooms differ just alittle bit from each other. The view from the rooms ver breathtaking especially at night. I would come back and stay here at this hotel for a personal vacation as well as buisness. I would rate this hotel a 10.

Reviews.Title: “Far from amazing”
Reviews.Author: rdeegan
Reviews.Content: Room was tiny like a college dorm with no drawers and only 5 hangers. Extremely noisy, waited 10 minutes for hot water in the mornings, AC struggling and room still damp, wireless weak and had to ask desk for ethernet cable to connect. Great location just 2 blocks from convention center and near West End. Bar and food prices were fine for a "trendy" hotel in NYC, but not for Dallas. Staff was friendly. There's a Crown Plaza and the Adolphus nearby - try them instead.

Reviews.Title: “Would do it all over again”
Reviews.Author: pamcheyne
Reviews.Content: Very unique, staff was very friendly and helpful. Hotel was located close to everything that we wanted to see and also close to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Aloft”
Reviews.Author: ruthkmz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I usually stay at traditional chain hotels, but a friend recommended aloft and we are glad she did. The the bed was wonderful, the shower spacious, and the room excellent. The staff was helpful and the lobby interesting. The only negative is that we could hear some noises from the couple next door. We were not able to enjoy all the amenities of the hotel as it was only a one night stay, but we do plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The most mis-managed hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: marybytheriver
Reviews.Content: " A vision of W Hotels" is the tagline used to describe this hotel brand. Accurate, if their vision is of mismanagement and ineptitude. This hotel did not have a reliable air-conditioning system during much of our 5 week stay in June; this frequently resulted in rooms that were 90 degrees with no air circulation (windows do not open). Several members of our group were told they had to change rooms upon returning from work at 11PM on Sunday night. Rooms with a "Do Not Disturb" sign were regularly entered; on at least one occasion to remove a microwave (and not replace it) for no apparent reason. Hot water was not available on several occasions. Power was shut off completely one afternoon; the only advance notice was taped to elevator doors, rather that placed under room doors. One of our group's rental cars was "booted" in the parking lot even though registered to stay another 2 weeks. An additional charge to my credit card appeared days after checking out and paying in full. A call to the Aloft confirmed that this was their error and they promised to credit my card immediately; a week has passed and nothing has been done. These are only a few examples. My colleagues and I are frequent travelers; we agree that we have never stayed in a more poorly run property. The only thing I can recommend in their housekeeping staff, who did an excellent job of maintaining this dismally renovated old warehouse. It must be that "vision" thing: bravely furnished with cheerfully insubstantial plastic and vinyl, with exposed and rustically lathed concrete ceilings and not a padded floor the entire building. Stay for no more than 1 night and hope you don't experience what we constantly endured for 5 weeks. The Magnolia and the lovely Adolphus are only 2 or 3 blocks away; stay there instead.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with superb staff!”
Reviews.Author: musicdonembry
Reviews.Content: I took a group of 20 teenagers to Dalls and we stayed at the aloft downtown for 3 nights. It was the cleanest, coolest most modern hotel with a great lobby and wonderful staff that went way beyond theoir call of duty. Everyone from the fornt desk to the cleaning crew were so very nice and helpful. I would recommend aloft to anyone going to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing in every way!”
Reviews.Author: LeaveHome
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the lobby, to checking out four days later we were thrilled with every aspect of Aloft! The service was friendly and efficient, our large king room was incredibly well-designed, extremely comfortable and completely quiet, and the downtown location is convenient to everything. There was nothing not to like about Aloft!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent choise”
Reviews.Author: Tete79
Reviews.Content: An excelent option to be in downtown, the furniture is awesome, the bar is nice, the pool is small but itÂ´s a good place to meet people... the personnel is friendly... itÂ´s better than Sheraton, Hilton even some Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service I have experienced yet”
Reviews.Author: LClingman
Reviews.Content: Very neat and modern hotel. However, we had 3 rooms reserved that were supposed to be next to each other. Turns out they did not have the rooms and we ended up on 3 different floors. (It took about 2 hours to get to this point.) They never once apologized and were quite rude. Upon check out, the rooms were all supposed to be held under the same credit card number; however, they charged all 3 rooms to the card that was provided for "incidentals" upon check-in. They messed up again and never once apologized. This is a cool, modern hotel -- but do not stay here if you want good service.

Reviews.Title: “What a fun and trendy place.”
Reviews.Author: FtWorthHotel
Reviews.Content: My wife had a wedding to go to in the Dallas area so we decided to stay the night in big D. We chose the Aloft to stay the night. It was a very trendy hotel with very spacious and clean rooms with all the ammenities. We went out to dinner and returned around 9:30 in the evening. We were trying to decide what to do for entertainment and it was real easy to figure out once we walked in. The nightlife at the hotel lobby/bar was great. Lots of nice people just hanging out ! Lots of fun. When I stay in Dallas again, there is no question where I will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “What a great concept!”
Reviews.Author: TJWBRP
Reviews.Content: We loved the Downtown Dallas Aloft Hotel and plan to stay at Aloft Hotels whenever possible. This is a great location for anyone attending an event at the Dallas Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience ever, do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: zybergrrl23
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband with a stay at the aloft in mid June 2010. There are so many hotels we could have chosen and we live in Dallas so we were only there to have a get-a-way and enjoy some time together. The hotel is modern and trendy and I enjoyed that part of it. When we got back from dinner and drinks, we planned to hang out in their bar, the wxyz bar. There was a birthday party and after-wedding party going on so it was really loud and rowdy. This was not a big deal but we had one drink and then decided to enjoy a more peaceful evening in our room. When we got to our room around 10pm, there was a huge party next door. People were very loud and pouring out of it. We asked to be moved and they moved us to a 7th floor corner room. The room was fine but it didn't have a few of the amenities that normal hotel rooms do such as an ice bucket, glasses to drink, etc. The 7th floor was hot and musty and smelled like chlorine. When we got into the room, we realized the a/c was on a sensor so there was no a/c on until we walked in. Although it took quite a long time to cool the room (this is Texas in June), we were ok with it and happy to enjoy the hotel. Then, we went to sleep... We both woke up at least once an hour, if not more, completely sweat soaked. The sensor did not stay on since there was no motion in the room so as soon as we fell asleep, the a/c would shut off. I called downstairs and they informed me that there was not a technician in the hotel until tomorrow. I said, we are only staying one night and he said there was nothing he could do about it. I had the worst night of my life and my husband's birthday night was ruined. In addition, there was another rowdy and drunk hotel guest in the hallway at 2am, screaming at the top of his lunges and acting very belligerent. I felt like I was in a college dorm room or at a frat party. I have asked for the manager's name and number and plan to try and get my money back but no one at the "Aloha" desk seemed to care much. For $165, this is the biggest waste of money. Do not spend your hard earned money here, please.

Reviews.Title: “Convention Center Convenience for a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Ladeelawyer
Reviews.Content: An old building converted to loft type rooms, this works. If you understand people choose loft living 24/7 for their homes, it is not surprising it works for short stays. They have done a good job in this conversion. Rooms are quire spacious, well appointed, good televisions, desk space, toiletries. The self serve eating area is better than most snack selections in gift shops. There is "window service" where you can order hot food, including breakfast. Prices are higher than grocery stores, but very reasonable compared to restaurants. This is directly across from the convention center and about 4 blocks from Main Street where there are bars and restaurants to suit most tastes. The only glitch here was check-in took longer than in most hotels. Parking is $6 per day -- this means if you stay 1 night you pay for 2 days, as they charge you for each day the car is in the lot for any part of the day! A bit unusual, but this averages out to $9 per night -still cheaper than in some major cities.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabolous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 210mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the aloft for the first time in February 2010. I loved this hotel completely. From the friendly staff, the nice bar to the exquisite rooms. We are taking a trip back to Dallas on 6/4/2010 and I couldn't help but book the Aloft again but this time we will bring the kiddos. I look forward to another great stay.

Reviews.Title: “We spent two nights here and were...”
Reviews.Author: LSBurdett
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here and were surprised that such a hip, young hotel would have problems with their tech amenities. Firstly the free wifi was spotty and slow to the point of being unusable. When we asked for a computer to use they directed us to one in the lobby that wasn't even on. Lastly when trying to use one of their checkout kiosks to print boarding passes it didn't work due to lack of paper. All of these issues could be easily fixed if the young staff would pay attention to them but they seemed more interested in talking amongst themselves. The room otherwise was quite functional and quiet. There is plenty of parking ($6/day) and the location is easy to get to whether you are coming by car or train. I look forward to trying other Aloft hotels as they seem to offer good value if everything they offer is up and running.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: txausrr
Reviews.Content: Problems with keys at Check-In, security had to let me in room. DId not get key until next morning. Great location and rooms were good too. Great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and modern atmosphere, no restaurant though”
Reviews.Author: Maikailoa
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and convenient with the convention center a block away. Trendy decor, cool way to integrate the existing 'warehouse' built-ins. Service was friendly and welcoming. Traveled with a high school group. Kid's liked that it had an exercise room and free Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Renaue
Reviews.Content: When you enter the lobby you know you're in for an exciting stay. Front desk staff were efficient and accomodating with every request. The rooms are HUGE with ample provision for working and resting. We needed to meet with a client and the staff happily arranged for us to use on of the "boardrooms" on our hotel floor. It was the perfect quiet setting for our meeting. Finally, the heavenly bed is.....heavenly! Even though located in the heart of Downtown Dallas, i slept like a baby. Great place!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern fun hotel with very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: talicat
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quaint, traditional hotel look elsewhere, but if you want something a bit different, fun and modern look no further than the Aloft Dallas. I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during April 2010 with my sister and friends and had a wonderful time. My sister and I had a 2 queen bed room, it was a good size, clean and we were fortunate to have a view of the pioneer plaza. The beds were the most comfortable we had in all the hotels we stayed in. The staff were very helpful with printing out directions and advice. The snack area was okay, a bit basic, fruit, muffins etc, the bagels were displayed when they were still frozen.Good selection of coffee/tea. If you are in Dallas as a tourist the Aloft is in a good location, you can walk to the 6th floor museum in 15 mins. Some guests might find the decor in the bedrooms unusual ,bare brick walls, uncovered pipes etc. I liked the look as I felt it added charactor to the hotel.The only down side would be the showers they were not powerful or warm enough on times. But as the hotel had only been open 5 months this is probably teething problems.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Coolest hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: debra4tall
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Modern, cool, hip! Kept looking to see where you would land a space ship! Staff was super! Bar area was great for relaxing and people watching! Now just need to figure out a way to return! It is a MUST hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, clean building and rooms, trendy chic, rooms have mad echo.”
Reviews.Author: Boblish
Reviews.Content: The staff was on it! Very attentive, knowledgeble and helpful (based in large on my experience with Justin and April). Nice lobby and bar for meeting up with group before or after night in downtown. Room was clean and had what I needed for a restful stay however my room had a deafing echo so watch the volumes if you are shy. The regular starting rate is about right for what you get but I would not pay much more. My view was of parking garages but whatever....there are definetly better views to be had here if that is a priority but I personally would not pay more than the starting rate for them (I received a corporate rate and at that price I was stoked and would SUPER recommend). April and Justin are a platinum standard...keep it up!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Cold Shower”
Reviews.Author: TeocaliJeepin
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. Cool space/building. Walking distance to Hyatt convention center. Great welcome gift for Starwood Platinum level guests. However....Shower was cold at 6:30 am. That is my kryptonite for a hotel. I am sure something was amiss, thus my good rating. I am a fan of the Aloft properties and this one is really great. I just hope they figure out the water issue!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place and can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: yahighness
Reviews.Content: Nice, trendy place to stay:) Got there and it just so happened to be the grand opening weekend celebration...it didn't bother me at all, I kinda liked the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: garudasunshine
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel - very hip and cool and relaxing in a way that lets you have fun while you get a chance to chill. The simple modern lines combine with the renovated authenticity of the original building to create a fab retro redux. The XYZ Bar is an excellent place to have a drink and socialize. The staff is ultra friendly and attentive and the rooms are extremely well designed and comfortable. I would recommend this ultra sweet hotel to anyone, whether coming in from out of town or just looking for an escape from the city.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is comfortable, sleek, friendly, well-located and really cool.”
Reviews.Author: waxwonders
Reviews.Content: The Aloft Hotel is fun to look at. The space is funky, yet sleek and modern with artful touches everywhere. The concept works well for me; a comfortable, well-appointed room in an upscale and trendy hotel without the high price or "stuffiness" factor. I liked re:fuel, the snack bar area as it's quick and open all the time. Their Aloha desk is really great. We had a lot of questions about the area and were always impressed with the helpful attitude and knowledge of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “comfy & stylish. lofty.”
Reviews.Author: TPFolair
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling with a touring company for the better part of a year and this hotel is a breath of the freshest air imaginable. The rooms are huge, stylish and comfortable. The personnel; friendly and helpful. Most importantly, NOTHING IS BEIGE, like most every other hotel in the country. I will be here for two weeks and I will not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Good concept but some issues”
Reviews.Author: okcJohn
Reviews.Content: Really neat concept and great lines. Cool vibe. Clean, quiet and felt safe. Issues- we booked suite because of kids and it was not a suite. Called downstairs and they said it was a suite. Their website says seperate sleeping area but our room was just one large room with a sleeper sofa across from bed and one extra chair. The tv is mounted directly over the sofa sleeper so you have to sit on bed or floor to watch tv. No breakfast table like in the picture. Room was very loft like but the bed was not comfortable. There is a coffee maker in the room with a tea and coffee and a decaf but ONLY one of each so if you and spouse both drink coffee, one will have to have tea. I think this hotel is a neat concept and has good bones but just needs some fine tuning. It is a inexpensive hotel but is not what you would expect from a W hotel line. (For comparision...I am thinking of the Springhill and fairfield lines of Marriott where the rooms/beds are still as comfortable as a JW or Marriott) I would stay here again if needed to be in this area but probably not with the kids and would not book a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel design, rooms, service”
Reviews.Author: Typ
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on a business trip and was impressed with the set up, location, rooms and service

Reviews.Title: “Different”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel65
Reviews.Content: Aloft Hotel is different from your conventional hotels. Like the name says it's decorated in "loft" style, concrete, exposed ducts, etc. Nice service, quick check in. Bar looked nice. No restaurant or room service. There was sort of a dining room in the lobby where they served breakfast and had things you could buy like milk and fruit. Rooms are ultra modern again loft style, a LOT of grey which I don't really care for but that is just me. Nice and very clean bathroom. Very nice shower, no tub, but the water temperature was not very hot and you better take a quick shower or it will turn cold before you're finished. After a little while it turns warm again. Not for those of us who like long, hot showers. The bed was super comfy and nice big TV. Location is excellent, right in front of the convention center. Restaurants are nearby but you have to take a taxi or drive your car if you don't want to walk in downtown at night which I thought it was kind of desolate. It was a Thursday night though, so maybe it's more lively during the weekends. It's a nice unique hotel. Definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, great location, large comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: lapetat
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 1 night on 2/26/10 and loved it!! it was our 1st time at an aloft and we are so impressed. the ambience of the hotel is just amazing. the bar area was great with lots of people drinking and having fun. theyve got free pool tables which we took advantage of! the hotel is very trendy and has a "hip" vibe to it. its right downtown so the location is great! parking is $6 which sucks but oh well. we had a ultra savvy suite on the 8th floor with a view of a pond/cemetary which was actually a nice view... our suite was huge and had 2 living areas which was awesome! there was 2 large flat screen tvs one in each living area. the bed was large and very comfy. we went to dallas for the nightlife and was very diappointed but the hotel made up for it. the place they call "remix" was awesome and had music playing and lots of people socializing. they had an awesome gym with indiviual tvs hooked up to the cardio equipment. they also have an outdoor pool with lots of neat furniture surronding it. aloft has free internet, bottled water/coffee/tea, safe boxes, and mini fridges. everything about aloft is so neat and trendy. i love this hotel and will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice..but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: Y2k7JK
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on this hotel before deciding where to stay here in Dallas. Overall, it's a beautiful building with very polite staff. #1, There is no building entrance on the parking lot side...You have to walk past 1 or three sides to get in depending on which direction you take...#2 The shower was JUST this side of pathetic. :( Only one of my three showers actually had warmer-than-warm water, the other two were barely lukwarm--As in I had goosebumps before getting out. Secondly..NO water pressure...Thishotel uses the large "rain" showerheads that just really do nothing for me. 3. There is no information about anything in the area in the rooms. I wouldn't have minded something that told about the restaurants, perhaps some nice place to unwind..not even a phonebook. Anyway,,,the beds were pretty comfortable, the view was nice..I just feel like this place could be something really special if it just went a little farther....

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL IS AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CleopatraDallas_TX
Reviews.Content: The Aloft is by far the best hotel in downtown Dallas! It has a contemporary, up-beat energy and the rooms are so spacious and comfortable. I love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Fun digs”
Reviews.Author: VariousPlaces
Reviews.Content: So my trip to the Aloft hotel was for a fun little planned, overnight rendevous ;) Of course I won't be going into details about that, but hey, that's what I was at this spot for. We don't all go to hotels to sleep. It was pretty ideal though because we were able to sit down on the couch in the lounge and chat it up for a little bit before going up to our room. The bar was in the same area as the lounge, but somewhat sectioned off. There was a nice fireplace that separated us from the bar for a little bit more privacy. The feel of this hotel was that it was very much on the trendy and hip side. I'm in my 20's and there were also other people around my age hanging out on the first floor. This was on a Saturday evening though. I must say that this hotel was a little difficult for me to find though. No visible signs to indicate that I was at the hotel or anything. It's downtown and surrounded by other tall building of various sorts so you think your just driving by another building instead of a hotel. Maybe that's my fault because we don't have swanky hotels where I live, but some visible eye-level signage at this hotel would be helpful. Just a suggestion. While I was driving to the hotel, there were some hobos on the street. Not surprising because it is located downtown, but it did worry me a little. The parking lot was not well lit either! Except for the small side slit. Major safety hazard! As for the actual room itself, it was fun looking! Definitely different than what I'm used to staying in. But it fit the occasion that I was there for which was a fun evening. I'd recommend this hotel for a short trip or stay. If you and your friend or mate want somewhere hip and trendy to getaway, this might be a place to consider. I saw more of a younger crowd here. So this place will not suit everyone's taste. The bathroom was pretty cool looking and there were things about the room that made it a little eccentric which I like. It was a good experience getting to stay somewhere that I usually wouldn't. I didn't actually have to pay for the room either, and if I couldn't get a good deal on a room here, I probably wouldn't stay there again myself. Simply because I don't need all the frills to make my stay somewhere enjoyable. All I typically need is nice looking, modern, clean and safe hotel. And I can get that at a great price almost anywhere! Especially somewhere like Dallas. This was the type of hotel where you were paying more for the look and fancy-shmancy atmosphere than anything else. There was no fridge or microwave in the room, no free-breakfast or complimentary anything. So I'm confident that you can find better places to stay for better prices in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, but has issues”
Reviews.Author: Oleredandblue
Reviews.Content: Easy check in, self parking, convenient location. Lobby is enormous, bar is friendly. Rooms other than my one issue were up to Starwood/W par. My one concern on my visit...Heat, or lack there of. True it was bitter cold for Dallas, but it was not until the 10th call and 3rd day that they could get the remote digital A/C unit in my room to get the temp above 62. They set it on 80 in the room..my Columbia jacket therm. never got above 62. Bit chilly for bare concrete floors and walls, much less enjoying that spacious shower!

Reviews.Title: “W Vibe for Half the Price”
Reviews.Author: LeopardSpot
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights over Christmas and loved this hotel. For almost the same price as staying at the Best Western we got the run of a brand new, funky, clean, spacious loft room overlooking the park. Aloft is branded as 'A vision of W Hotels' and it really lives up to the claim. The bed was big and comfy, we had a big spacious lounge area and seperate desk/office area. Free bottled water every day and the same Bliss toiletries as you'd get in the W. We were able to do our laundry in coin operated machines for $2 per wash which is unheard of in your usual hotels. There is no room service but the hotel has a 24 hour canteen with a variety of food - toast your own bagels and get fresh espresso for breakfast, grab a feshly made salad for lunch or a fresh muffin or cookie for a snack. They even have ice-cream and candy, plus a whole range of incidentals (things you might need to pop out to a 7/11 for in the middle of the night). The best thing is that everything is really cheap. Most decent hotels charge you $20+ for breakfast but we managed to escape for under $5 each. After five days this really saved us some cash. The only negative about the hotel is there is not a lot close by - no restaurants, shopping etc. but I found this pretty typical of Dallas CBD - there's not a lot going on. The hotel is close to the freeways so you can get around easily. Plus parking was only $6/night - another plus. Oh...and free internet. We'd go back for sure. Enjoy it while it's shiny and new.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Modern, reminds me of New York Hotels”
Reviews.Author: firemanswife2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our Anniversary on a Friday evening. Check in was easy, 3 people working the desk, and they were helpful and friendly. We noticed immediately how the lobby reminded us of a few trendy hotels in NYC. Though we didn't use the bar, it seemed crowded with happy people. Our room was on the 9th floor, facing South Dallas. Which was fine at night, the lights where actually pretty. Our room, like the lobby, was modern. Had a large King bed w/ a great flat screen TV hanging on the wall. We both like that we had our own reading light above our side of the bed. The bathroom had a shower only, which was a slight bummer for me. Only becuase I love to soak in the tub. But the shower was large and had great water pressure. We also liked that there were 2 complimentary bottles of water in the room. The next morning, we went downstairs to the re-fuel station and got Starbucks coffee. Yeah! Though, we didn't eat here, they had plenty to choose from if we had. Before we left we walked through the workout room, mainly just so I could report about it here and we'd know for next time. It was a good size workout room with TV's, water, and even a box of earphones (if you need some). This hotel would be awesome for anyone in town for a Convention as it is steps away from The Dallas Convention Center. We'll absolutely return to this hotel, next time we are going to a concert or just want to hang out in Dallas for the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe”
Reviews.Author: somegirl85
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel last night. We got there in the afternoon and it started out fine but then her car got broken into and some things were stolen. On top of that, it was in the middle of the afternoon when it happened and the car wasn't far from the front entrance. In fact, it could be seen from the lobby. Needless to say, the rest of our stay there was ruined. The staff didn't seem surprised about the break-in and theft. Apparently situations like this are not uncommon there. If you do stay at this hotel, DO NOT leave anything in your vehicle. You might as well assume that it will be broken into, even in the daytime.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: h0llybelle
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the time that we were at this location. The service was great from the moment we stepped up to the desk. We are Starwood Preferred, but I felt that everyone at the desk at the time was given great service. It was New Year's Eve so you can imagine that there was a few people. The location was wonderful, and the room was great as well. I wish we would have brought our Min Pin with us. It really seemed like a pet-friendly place! Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and pretty convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Minnie_enger
Reviews.Content: For $80 a night, I think this Aloft was a great deal. The check in staff was friendly and efficient. The location of this hotel is downtown and not uptown with all the other fancy hotels like W, Ritz Carlton. But that is ok because it takes a few minutes to get to uptown if you have to meet people there. It is accessible to highways so you can jet to different parts of Dallas quickly. Our room was a handicap room and we had almost 400 sqft to ourselves! The bathroom was big and the whole room was clean. The bed was comfy and I enjoyed the big screen TV. The only small problem was the sink's stopper was stuck. Parking was $6 a night which bummed me out a little but I guess that's what downtown gets you. If we have friends that want to go to Dallas for a cheap but clean and quiet place, I would recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “A refreshing, affordable change from conventional hotels”
Reviews.Author: Melina1222
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice in the last few weeks and thoroughly enjoyed each visit. The building is actually a reclaimed freight/railroad depot and some of the original beams, brickwork and other details are still visible. Both of my rooms were impeccable, comfortable and wonderful bargains, right down to the free bottled water (none of those sneaky bar fridge charges) and Bliss toiletries. And there's even plenty of free parking - a rarity in downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “A facility that has a lot of growing up to do.”
Reviews.Author: LittleItalySD
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood Preferred Guest and think the Aloft concept is a good one; essentially it's a stripped down W - minimal amenities, but nice rooms and space. The service at this specific property was managed by a group of kid's maybe in their early 20s. Noise issues prevail (walls and doors are thin); we changed rooms three times Suggest staying on floors 5 or higher. Front desk staff aren't equipped to handle problems and although the fitness center is nice, 50% of the equipment didn't work during our visit. The "a la carte" style onsite cafe ran out of bananas and our bill was wrong on checkout. Terrible smell of manuer at front entrance. Nearby restauarant recommendations were moderate at best. I can deal with the sub-luxe property, but expect much more from Starwood leadership.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice”
Reviews.Author: RDuda
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel. Kind of had the feel of the loft on the old show My Two Dads. The rooms were great. Really big, 2 flat screen tv's. Right across the street from the Dallas convention center and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a cool new hotel”
Reviews.Author: frisco057
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the ALOFT hotel in downtown Dallas last weekend. The owners did a great job converting an old warehouse building into a cool new hotel. The rooms were unique, due to the configuration of the original building and surprisingly - very quiet at night ( we were on the 5th floor). The staff/service was great and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay - I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Aloft Studio Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BesseB
Reviews.Content: Prob best place we've stayed in the US so far. Highlights included great decor, well-stocked food service and outstanding customer service. Worth the extra $

Reviews.Title: “Finally....a fun, chic, dog friendly hotel in Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: dgward1979
Reviews.Content: I travel for work and have stayed a number of Aloft hotels over the past year. This hotel is by far the best in this concept and is one of the top hotels downtown. The decor is great, the staff is helpful and the rates are reasonable. We had both dogs with us, they brought us a full pet kit that included: beds, bowls, treats and toys. Our suite was larger than apartments I had in college, I think they charge roughly $200/night on average for that room. It was a great first experience, I am ready to book my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, acceptable stay, questionable service”
Reviews.Author: SPGPlatHick
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at Le Meridien Dallas North because the rates are superb for a four star hotel. At $139/night for Aloft, it was a better rate than what Le Merdien was offering this time around. Here some important take aways: + Parking is free + Internet is free + Bottled water is free + Gym is modern, clean, and odour free + Pool is a little small + I was upgraded to a suite. Not many alofts have suites. + Chelsea in reception is very nice and helpful - Located in an area is that dead at night. Car/Taxi is encouraged, walking... probably not. - Questionable windows. Aloft Dallas wanted to keep the aesthetics of the building, so they kept the really old single pane windows that involve pushing a rusty metal bar in order to open the window. The rusty bar has sharp edges that could cause you to get cut while operating the window. Though I'm staying here in the Fall season. The summers could get really hot and winters really cold in the room because of drafts through the old windows. (See picture) - While the weekends might not be a problem, there was lots of traffic in the morning starting at 6am, even though I was on the eighth floor, I could still hear cars rolling by. The curtains did not help with the noise suppression. - When I arrived at the hotel, Both tvs weren't working. I called down to the Front Desk three times within 35 minutes wondering where the engineer was. The tvs automatically started working, but I never got a call asking me if the tvs were working again. - There is an electrical socket that is very close to the bathroom faucet. The sink is one of those modern bowls that are small. While washing my face, I noticed that I splashed water all over the mirror and socket plate. This could cause an electrocution situation. (See picture) Overall, The stay was comfortable, and the staff is very nice. Whoever designed the hotel didn't really think about some things and hopefully... you the reader should take caution.

Reviews.Title: “A few kinks that need to be worked out..”
Reviews.Author: geo655
Reviews.Content: This hotel opened two months before my stay, so I expected that there still might be a few bugs that needed sorting out. I was correct, but I really think this hotel has the potential to be really good.. I booked my room using Starwood points. When I arrived to check in, they could not find my reservation and asked for my confirmation #. I stay in a lot of Starwood hotels on points, and have never been asked for the confirmation #. I had to go out to my car and get my laptop, and show the lady the email that they sent me, which included the conf. #. She still couldn't find it, and finally just made me a new reservation. That was fine, but I was wondering what would have happened if they didn't have vacancies- I'd probably have been out of luck. Another reviewer mentioned this happening- this is a pretty serious thing- they really need to take care of the people who have chosen the Starwood brand. Lobby was pretty nice, they had a bar with cool modern seating and light fixtures. I didn't have a drink there, so I can't speak to how good the bar is. They also have a little "store" close to the check in desk. It has toiletries, snacks, drinks, sandwiches/wraps, salads, etc. Prices were a little high (as expected.) My wife and I split a wrap, and it was similar to what you'd get out of a convenience store cooler, only more expensive. The room was OK, but there were a few things that didn't really make sense. First off, the overall look: pretty cool. There was exposed brick and huge concrete columns, it looked like.... well... "a loft.." Even though we were on the 8th floor, views from the windows were so-so, and we only had one window in the main room. The bathroom is pretty cool looking, there was another window actually IN the shower that they put a see through shade over. (Hopefully, you can see out, but no one can see in.) Kind of weird to be standing naked showering by a full length window that you can see out of. So as I said before, there were a few details that didn't make sense. On one wall, there are two tables/desks separated by sort of a bench. Even though there were 2 identical desks, there was only one chair. When we ate our wrap from the lobby, we wanted to pull both chairs up and eat together on one table, but we couldn't. Closet- luckily, we were only in town for a couple of days. There isn't really a closet to hang suits/jackets or dresses. There was a little alcove that had a couple of hangers in it where you would have to hang your garment parallel with the wall (with the front or back facing you, instead of the shoulder like in a regular closet- I hope that makes sense.) Anyway, I guess you could have hung 1 or 2 garments, but not more. Amenities- they give you a fridge, which is awesome. Free WiFi. There is also a coffee maker, and you get complimentary coffee and bottled water. There was something that was missing- and I don't know if I've ever stayed in a hotel in my life that didn't have this. There were no glasses/plastic cups, and there was no ice bucket. The front desk told me that ice was available in the little "store." I don't know if they charge for it, or if you just pick it up. I saw some little "ice bucket size" bags in a freezer in the store. I didn't get a bag, but IF they charge for it, that's ridiculous. Even the Super 8 doesn't charge for ice. I inquired about getting glasses (I was planning on having a few cocktails in the room, but we ended up staying out so late that I didn't) and the guy told me that when the bar opened, they could get me some glasses.. Again, seems like that could be easily solved by putting some plastic cups in the room- I guess they feel like the bottled water takes care of that.. Parking was fine, it was $6 a day, and right on the hotel property (you didn't have to walk far.) Shuttle- I was told when I checked in that there's a shuttle that would take you from the hotel to the West End. This was awesome- only problem was that in 2 days, I never saw it. Cab rides to the West End (tons of restaurants, bars, shopping, etc.) were $6-$8. Location of the hotel was great- really close to JFK museum, Dallas Holocaust Museum, West End, House of Blues (if you are in town for a concert/show as we were- it's about an $8 cab ride). All in all, there are some weird little details that should be fixed, but overall I thought the hotel was pretty cool, and has the potential to be really great.

Reviews.Title: “GAVE AWAY MY ROOM AND NEARLY RUINED MY TRIP”
Reviews.Author: spgplat2
Reviews.Content: My mother just turned 55 and for her birthday my father and I purchased tickets for our family to attend the Texas - Oklahoma football game in Dallas. She is one of the biggest University of Texas fans and on her list of things to do before she dies, this was number 8. Hotels generally sell out early and cost was a huge concern given the high price of tickets so I had booked us reservations for two rooms at the Aloft Dallas on August 18th. Then I noticed that they disappeared out of my account and so I decided to call and see what the deal was. No one could explain how my reservations were lost and since they had no record of them, they refused to honor them. I was only offered to book at the current rate, which was higher at that point and there were no longer any suites available. All I was able to book was a King room for two nights using points, but I had to book another room at another hotel because the Aloft didn't have any suites or two double bed rooms available. I then called a week before my stay to make sure they had my new reservation. The woman at the front desk and the manager both basically called me a liar, saying that if I had made a reservation online they would have it. I had to call the national reservations number and have them e-mail the hotel a copy of my reservation before they believed me. The manager said he'd call me back after he received the e-mail, but never did. He was then unavailable when I called again, but this time they had my reservation on file, so I didn't press it. So now the day arrives. After a full day of flying, I arrived at the Aloft hotel a little before midnight. I walked up to the desk, and was immediately told that they have no more rooms available, and they'll try to get me into another hotel. So after calling numerous times to confirm, they still screwed it up. I was extremely upset, as was my entire family. I am a platinum preferred guest and should not have my room given away, EVER. After I sat at the desk for 45 minutes while they called hotels in the area, I told them I hadn't eaten and was going to walk to get some food and if they could call me immediately when they have it figured out. After about 25 minutes, the manager called and said that he has a room at a Hyatt Place and for me to come by the hotel for the paperwork. I inquire as to the location of the hotel and he tells me it is in FORT WORTH, which is 30 miles away!!!! The game was at 11am in the morning and traffic is horrible so this was unacceptable, not to mention I didn't even have a car. He then said he could put me Irving which was a less atrocious 17 miles away. Hardly comparable as the entire reason to stay downtown is to be able to take the DART to the game and to avoid gameday traffic. Since I didn't have a car I couldn't have even gotten to Fort Worth or the game so I told him that I didn't want to stay in Fort Worth or Irving and that I would have to make alternate accomodations on my own. He said they would try to fit me in the next day, but after making alternate plans I called the next day to let them know not to even bother. Three things really upset me about this situation. When I arrived, the woman at the desk mentioned that a woman earlier had nearly threatened to kill her because they gave away her room and she appreciated me being cordial to her because she of course had nothing to do with reservations. This upset me because it shows that they KNEW about this problem much earlier and did NOTHING to try to make alternate plans for me until I got there. It's clear they were basically hoping people didn't show up so they could avoid the problem. How hard would it have been to call me when they realized the problem to give me a heads up and to let me know they were working on it? Secondly, I was never offerred any sort of compensation nor have I received an apology call or e-mail since the incident. This upsets me even more because not only should they have been working on this problem from the second they realized it (I'm positive they could have fixed it because the person right in front of me was booked into a hotel right down the road) they didn't even care enough to try to appease me after I showed up. I expected, at the least, two complimentary nights at the hotel to be used whenever I returned to town in addition to having my points refunded for the stay. Neither of which has happened yet. Thirdly, throughout the entire situation, I was treated like I was an enormous hassle for them and that I was being ridiculous and difficult for being upset about being offered a hotel in Fort Worth. This was the best they could they said. This is a lie because they should have been trying to fix this problem hours before. The lobby was clean from what I could tell, but I was never able to see a room, because someone else was sleeping in it. TERRIBLE HOTEL AND HORRIBLE MANAGER.

HotelInfo.Name: Aloft Dallas Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 1033 Young Street, Dallas, TX 75202
